Why do the storks no longer come to the little Dutch fishing village
of Shora to nest?

Why do the storks no longer come to the little Dutch fishing village
of Shora to nest?

A little girl and her grandmother try to outwit a shape-changing,
greedy cuckoo bird who has tricked his way into their house.

book_title: Wider Than the Sky: Poems to Grow Up With
Summary:
A diverse anthology of poems by William Shakespeare, Dr. Seuss, Emily
Dickinson, and many others.

book_title: Scary Stories 3 : More Tales to Chill Your Bones (Scary Stories)
Summary:
Alvin Schwartz's Scary Stories 3 joins his other popular
collections of scary folklore, Scary Stories To Tell In The Dark and
More Scary Stories To Tell In The Dark, to give readers spooky, funny
and fantastic tales guaranteed to raise ...

Do you believe in ghosts? Some people do . . . These spooky -- and
funny -- tales about singing ghosts, toast-eating ghosts, and ghosts
no one even guesses are sure to send shivers up and down your spine.

book_title: Joyful Noise : Poems for Two Voices (Charlotte Zolotow Book)
Summary:
In this remarkable volume of poetry for two voices, a companion to I
Am Phoenix,Paul Fleischman verbally re-creates the
"Booming/boisterios/joyful noise" of insects.

book_title: The Path of the Pale Horse (Charlotte Zolotow Book)
Summary:
Lep, an apprentice to a doctor, helps his master take care of yellow
fever victims in Philadelphia during the epidemic of 1793.

Three tales of mystery, comic misadventures, and dark deeds focus on
what happens to people who put their trust and faith in graven images
In these three tales of chiseled figures-a wooden boy, a copper saint,
and the marble statue ...

Eleven-year-old Harriet keeps notes on her classmates and neighbors in
a secret notebook, but when some of the students read the notebook,
they seek revenge.

book_title: Hattie rabbit (An Early I can read book)
Summary:
Two stories about Hattie Rabbit who has a tendency to overlook
possible consequences of her actions.

A secretly married couple spends the summer tracking a herd of Rocky
Mountain goats which they conclude must not be hunted, even by the
boy's determined father.

book_title: Julie of the Wolves (Julie of the Wolves)
Summary:
Is she Miyax of the Eskimos—or Julie of the wolves? Don't miss any
of the books in Jean Craighead George's groundbreaking series:
Julie of the Wolves, Julie, and Julie's Wolf Pack.

book_title: Hurray for Hattie Rabbit: Story and pictures (An Early I can read book)
Summary:
Hattie Rabbit finds that mothers are sometimes difficult and sometimes
helpful.

She follows their customs, but the dangers of pollution and nuclear
war she's learned about in school seem much more real to her. How
can she believe the Seminole legends about talking animals and earth
spirits?

book_title: The magical adventures of Pretty Pearl (Charlotte Zolotow Book)
Summary:
" Drawing upon her fabulous storehouse of black legend, myth, and
folklore, Virginia Hamilton has ventured into new ways of exploring
the human spirit in this extrodinary fantasy filled with mysteries,
beauty, and hope.

The irrepressible Frances teaches Albert, the badger next door, about
friendship.

She won't touch her squishy soft-boiled egg. She trades away her
chicken-salad sandwich at lunch. She turns up her nose at boring veal
cutlets. Unless Mother can come up with a plan, Frances just might go
on eating bread and jam forever!

book_title: Arthur's Halloween Costume (I Can Read Book 2)
Summary:
No one knows what Arthur’s funny-looking costume represents, but even
his school principal calls it a winner! ‘Arthur’s frustrations and
hassles ring true, and kids will enjoy the constantly changing
costumes.

book_title: Danny and the Dinosaur (An I Can Read Book)
Summary:
But Danny can teach a old dinosaur new tricks. It's the most fun
this dinosaur has had in a hundred million years! Originally published
as An I Can Read Book over 40 years ago, this classic story is perfect
for reading together.

After lumbermen cut down his forest, Grizzwold—a large bear of the far
North—searches for a new home. Children will find his outrageous
adventures ‘utterly acceptable, real, and humorous.’ —H.

book_title: Look Out for Turtles! (Let's-read-and-find-out science book)
Summary:
Describes the remarkable turtle, which can live almost anywhere, eat
almost anything, range in size from tiny to gigantic, and live longer
than any other animal.

book_title: The Great Snake Escape (An I Can Read Book)
Summary:
Mirabel, a goose, and her friend, Maxie, a frog, get a scare one day
when a king cobra escapes from the zoo.

book_title: Zack's Alligator Goes to School (An I Can Read Book)
Summary:
In a full-color sequel to Zack's Alligator, Zack brings his sassy
Glades gator, Bridget, to show-and-tell, where she sings, skateboards,
and turns the classroom upside down.

book_title: Harold and the Purple Crayon 50th Anniversary Edition
Summary:
" Armed only with an oversized purple crayon, young Harold draws
himself a landscape full of wonder and excitement. Full of funny
twists and surprises, this joyful story shows just how far your
imagination can take you.

Based on the experiences of the Chinese who built the transcontinental
railroad at the time of the American Civil War, DRAGON'S GATE is
the compelling story of one boy's struggle to rebuild his dreams
against overwhelming odds.

book_title: Thank You, Amelia Bedelia (I Can Read Book 2)
Summary:
This new edition is sure to please every fan of Amelia
Bedelia'even Great-Aunt Myra!
Harold becomes a part of the picture he is drawing for his room

Could there something about this horrible clan state? Barbara Robinson
first introduced the unforgettable Herdmans in The Best Christmas
Pageant Ever.

book_title: I Stay Near You: 1 Story in 3
Summary:
Three generations suffer the consequences of an ill-fated romance
between a young girl from the wrong side of the tracks and the son of
the richest family in a small upstate New York town.

book_title: Me, me, me, me, me: Not a novel (Charlotte Zolotow Book)
Summary:
The author recounts escapades from her own teenage years and reveals
how many of those real-life people and events served as springboards
for the fictional characters and plots in her nine young adult novels.

This richly layered novel is in turn funny, mysterious, and touching.
Sharon Creech's original voice tells a story like no other, one
that readers will not soon forget.

First published in 1945 and never out of print, this timeless
combination of Ruth Krauss's simple text and Crockett
Johnson's eloquent illustrations creates a triumphant and deeply
satisfying story for readers of all ages.

book_title: Dust for Dinner (An I can read book)
Summary:
Jake narrates the story of his family's life in the Oklahoma dust
bowl and the journey from their ravaged farm to California during the
Great Depression.

Rite of Passage, Richard Wright's never-before-published story of
Johnny Gibbs's fall from grace, is as pertinent to the fate of
many young people today as it was when it was first conceived nearly
fifty years ago.

When skeletons, ghouls, witches, and assorted other spooky creatures
take up the rock beat, a town has its best-ever Halloween.

book_title: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe (The Chronicles of Narnia)
Summary:
Now considered a classic, The Lion, The Witch, and The Wardrobe is
C.S. Lewis's second book of The Chronicles of Narnia, which has
captured the imaginations of children for several generations.

book_title: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe (rpkg) (Narnia)
Summary: They open a door and enter a world.

book_title: Prince Caspian (rpkg) : The Return to Narnia (Narnia)
Summary:
C.S. Lewis's fourth book of The Chronicles of Narnia once again
brings us into his timeless world of magical creatures, miraculous
events, and noble battles against evil.

book_title: Prince Caspian (rpkg) : The Return to Narnia (Narnia)
Summary:
In his effort to bring peace to troubled Narnia, Prince Caspian blows
his magic horn to summons Peter, Susan, Lucy and Edmond to help him
with this difficult task.

book_title: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader (rpkg) (Narnia)
Summary:
Book five of The Chronicles of Narnia continues the saga of C.S.
Lewis's beloved land of fantastic creatures and unlikely heroes.
Readers of any age will be entranced as the crew of the Dawn Treader
approaches the "Worlds End."

This is the story of an adventure that happened in Narnia and Calormen
and the lands between, in the Golden Age when Peter was High King in
Narnia and his brother and his two sisters were King and Queens under
him.

The last battle is the greatest of all battles, and the final ending
the most magnificent of all endings in this, the last book of C.S.
Lewis's timeless series, The Chronicles of Narnia.

C.S. Lewis has once again worked his magic in this sixth book of The
Chronicles of Narnia.This master of fantasy brings us ever farther in
an unforgettable world filled with adventure and mystery.

Eustace and Jill follow Aslan's clues to find the captive Prince
Rilian and help him escape from the Emerald Witch's underground
kingdom.

In the first book of The Chronicles of Narnia, C.S. Lewis shows us how
it all began -- the glorious birth of Narnia at the hand of its
unforgettable King.

Pussycat knows Christmas is coming, plays in the snow, and watches the
Christmas preparations.

Young Rooster thinks his Gift is making the sun rise, until one
morning when the sun rises without him.

book_title: The Tarantula in My Purse : and 172 Other Wild Pets
Summary:
Humorous, heart-warming, and just plain entertaining, these stories by
Newbery Medalist Jean Craighead George recall what life was like as
she raised three children and 173 wild pets.

book_title: Little Chick's Breakfast (An Early I Can Read Book)
Summary:
Little Chick becomes hungrier and hungier and more and more impatient
as she watches all the other barynyard animals getting their breakfast
before she gets hers.

After a nuclear war devastates the earth, a small band of people
struggles for survival in a new world where children are born with
strange mutations.

Lying at the end of her life in the room where she was born in 1851,
Georgina remembers what it was like to grow up on the Ohio frontier.

A twelve-year-old girl sees her family differently when faced with
problems at her new school and near home.

book_title: Up in the Mountains: And Other Poems of Long Ago
Summary:
A collection of poems depicting the life of a young girl in turn-of-
the-century America.

book_title: Frankenstein Moved in on the Fourth Floor
Summary:
Robert and Sam suspect their weird new neighbor is really
Frankenstein.

Seven mouse boys lie awake one night . . . . . . And they ask their
Papa to tell them a story. Papa does better than that -- he tells them
seven stories, one for each boy.

book_title: Frog and Toad Together (I Can Read Book 2)
Summary:
And when both Frog and Toad are scared, they are brave together. From
the first enchanting story to the last, these five adventures of two
best friends are filled with humor and tender affection. 'Lobel
draws with precision and ease.

book_title: In the Year of the Boar and Jackie Robinson
Summary:
In 1947, a Chinese child comes to Brooklyn where she becomes
Americanized at school, in her apartment building, and by her love for
baseball.

book_title: I feel like the Morning Star
Summary:
Three teenagers in a post-holocaust survival colony find that their
shelter has become a prison and decide to break out.

book_title: The Bear Next Door (An I Can Read Book)
Summary:
Three episodes in the developing friendship of Vic Bear and Arlo
Gopher demonstrate how they are good neighbors.

book_title: Tillie and Mert (An I Can Read Book)
Summary:
Best friends Tillie and Mert do everything together, from buying
"bargains" at Weasel's garage sale to telling fortunes
and opening their own grocery store.

book_title: Hocus and Pocus at the Circus (An I Can Read Book)
Summary:
A young witch tries in vain to teach her little sister how to spook a
Halloween circus.

Willa, who wants to feel extraordinary, thinks that she's in love
with the father of the boy next door until she realizes that her
"ordinary" true love is the boy himself.

book_title: Sarah, Plain and Tall (Sarah, Plain and Tall)
Summary:
When their father invites a mail-order bride to come live with them in
their prairie home, Caleb and Anna are captivated by their new mother
and hope that she will stay.

book_title: Beauty : A Retelling of the Story of Beauty and the Beast
Summary:
Her father protests that he will not let her go, but she answers,
"Cannot a Beast be tamed?" Robin McKinley's beloved
telling illuminates the unusual love story of a most unlikely couple:
Beauty and the Beast.
A collection of three Little Bear books.

book_title: Am I Blue?: Coming Out from the Silence
Summary:
A young woman not ready to make decisions about her future. Two best
friends at a summer community. A dying poet. A teenager taken in by
her friend's family after her own parents kick her out.

book_title: Am I Blue?: Coming Out from the Silence
Summary:
A young woman not ready to make decisions about her future. Two best
friends at a summer community. A dying poet. A teenager taken in by
her friend's family after her own parents kick her out.

book_title: If You Give a Moose a Muffin
Summary:
If a big hungry moose comes to visit, you might give him a muffin to
make him feel at home.

But Betsy, Tacy, and Tib always manage to have a good time. Ever since
their first publication in the 1940s, the Betsy-Tacy stories have been
loved by each generation of young readers.

But now there's Art Dog -- a new superhero on the block -- and
he's fighting crime with a paintbrush and an unstoppable creative
might.

The author of Linger explores the intricacies of sexual identity in a
the compassionate story of a young woman, teased for her boyishness
and pressured to be more feminine, and her complex relationship with
the rich, beautiful Patsy.

Molly's grandfather offers to take her to a huge toy store in New
York City and buy her one toy, but he does not realize what a
difficult time Molly will have making a decision about what to buy.

Having stopped eating after the death of her father, seventeen-year-
old Laurel feels herself losing control of her life in the hot,
magical world of Los Angeles.

"This is serious life Block is writing about—it's raw,
hellish, heavenly, and real."—SLJ.

book_title: Today I Feel Silly: And Other Moods That Make My Day
Summary:
Jamie Lee Curtis's zany and touching verse, paired with Laura
Cornell's whimsical and original illustrations, helps kids
explore, identify, and, even have fun with their ever-changing moods.

book_title: If You Give a Mouse a Cookie
Summary:
The consequences of giving a cookie to this energetic mouse run the
young host ragged, but young readers will come away smiling at the
antics that tumble like dominoes through the pages of this delightful
picture book.

book_title: If You Give a Mouse a Cookie
Summary:
A boy discovers that you can never tell where it will stop once you
have given a demanding mouse a cookie.

book_title: Pauses: Autobiographical Reflections of 101 Creators of Children's Books
Summary:
Authors, illustrators, and poets describe their childhoods, approaches
to creating children's books, and career paths

"The world's greatest detective" follows the clues that
lead to the King of Pooka Pooka's missing prize elephant.
"The character of Big Max, a kind of miniature Sherlock Holmes,
is well drawn in both words and pictures." —SLJ.

book_title: The Outside Dog (I Can Read Book)
Summary:
Marisol, who lives in Puerto Rico, wants a dog very much but her
grandfather will not let her have one, until a skinny mutt wins him
over.

Poor Screamin' Millie is just one of the unforgettable characters
in this wondrous new book of poems and drawings by the creator of
Where the Sidewalk Ends and A Light in the Attic.

book_title: Sunday Morning We Went to the Zoo
Summary:
When two sisters have different ideas about what they want to see, a
family day at the zoo turns out a little zany.

book_title: Arthur's Back to School Day (I Can Read Book 2)
Summary:
What will happen next on this exciting first day of school? Beginning
readers heading back to school will enjoy the humor in Lillian
Hoban's tenth I Can Read Book about these much loved characters.

As the family passes the winter in their cozy home, Papa Rabbit tells
them stories about other rabbits.

book_title: Addie Meets Max (Science I Can Read Book)
Summary:
Addie discovers that the new boy next door, Max, and his dog are not
so terrible when she helps Max bury his newly lost tooth.

book_title: Addie Runs Away an I Can Read (An Early I can read book)
Summary:
Not wishing to be sent away to Camp Putt, Addie is determined to run
away, unless her friend Max can convince her to change her mind.

Before Zoheret and her companions can populate a new planet, they must
learn to conquer those same instincts that almost destroyed their
ancestors on Earth over one hundred years ago.

book_title: Ten copycats in a boat, and other riddles (An I can read book)
Summary: A collection of riddles selected from folklore around the world.

A very sick dolphin is nursed back to health by the staff of a marine
aquarium and years later has a baby that becomes the star of the show
there.

Your future glimpsed in crystal ball...Hurry along! Thursday has
arrived, and the streets of this tiny Irish village are chock-full of
fun. What will you buy with your Market Day penny today?

Like an old tattered scrapbook overflowing with remembrances of days
past, this touching story and Dan Andreasens stunning illustrations
stand as a timeless tribute to the beauty of lifes memories and that
night so long ago when Halleys ...

As the stars whisper a lullabye at bedtime, the man in the moon and
the Milky Way welcome a child to dreamland.

A huge talking bird, a friendly giant, and other fantastic creatures
help David find his missing grandfather and discover the lessons every
Jewish boy should know.

Max is sent to bed without supper and imagines sailing away to the
land of Wild Things, where he is made king.

This 4-volume boxed set contains an alphabet book, a book of rhymes
about each month, a counting book, and a cautionary tale all written
and illustrated by Maurice Sendak.

Named the mystery column writer for the school newspaper, Maggie
revels in the power she can exert.

book_title: Mooch the messy (An I can read book)
Summary:
Only for love does a very messy young rat clean up his hole to make
his father's visit happier.

"Boy-girl relationships are depicted with warmth and
understanding in this lighthearted, funny story" —BL.

book_title: The Missing Piece Meets the Big O
Summary:
The different ones it encounters - and what it discovers in its
helplessness - are portrayed with simplicity and compassion in the
words and drawings of Shel Silverstein.

But as the boy grew older he began to want more from the tree, and the
tree gave and gave and gave. This is a tender story, touched with
sadness, aglow with consolation.

book_title: Where the Sidewalk Ends : Poems and Drawings
Summary:
If you are a dreamer, come in, If you are a dreamer, A wisher, a liar,
A hope-er, a pray-er, A magic bean buyer … Come in … for where the
sidewalk ends, Shel Silverstein’s world begins.

It was missing a piece. And it was not happy. So it set off in search
of its missing piece.

book_title: Lafcadio, The Lion Who Shot Back
Summary:
But is a famous, successful, and admired lion a happy lion? Or is he a
lion at all? Told and drawn with wit and gusto, Shel Silverstein's
modern fable speaks not only to children but to us all!

book_title: The Monster in the Third Dresser Drawer and Other Stories About Adam Joshua
Summary:
In a series of episodes, a young boy must cope with a move to a new
town, a new baby sister, a new tooth, a baby-sitter, and his Great-
Aunt Emily.

book_title: The Course of True Love Never Did Run Smooth
Summary:
While playing love-sick Helena in a high-school production of "A
Midsummer Night's Dream," Becky must untangle her own
feelings for handsome Blake and for her long-time friend Nehemiah, who
plays the role of Puck.

book_title: The show-and-tell war and other stories about Adam Joshua
Summary:
Five stories relate the adventures and misadventures of Adam Joshua as
he contends with the first day of school, pretending to be sick,
stealing a library book, making the scariest Halloween costume, and
being upstaged at show-and-tell time ...

An account of the search for, recovery, preservation, and study of the
fossilized remains of the dinosaur Velociraptor as narrated by two
paleontologists who led the expedition to Mongolia.

book_title: A Little Prairie House (Little House Picture Book)
Summary:
Renée Graef recieved her bachelor's degree in art from the
University of Wisconsin at Madison. She is the illustrator of teh
paper dolls and the Kirsten books in the American Girls Collection.

book_title: In the Middle of the Puddle
Summary:
A frog and a turtle watch the rain turn their puddle into an ocean
before the sun comes along and returns things to normal.

book_title: Hippo Lemonade (I Can Read Books (Harper Hardcover))
Summary:
Hippo and his animal friends share a variety of adventures including
making a wish, selling lemonade, and telling a scary story.

Time for bed, Biscuit! Biscuit is a little yellow puppy. And like most
puppies, he would rather play than go to bed. Will Biscuit ever go to
sleep? It's Biscuit's bedtime, but this lively little puppy
doesn't want to go to sleep!

An A-to-Z race for a buried treasure finds such characters as Anteater
the archer, Big Brown Bear, and Camel in the middle of an adventure
that is part alphabet fantasy and part guessing game that encourages
readers to search for hidden ...

More traditional and modern-day stories of ghosts, witches, vampires,
"jump" stories, and scary songs.

A motherless girl rediscovers hope and love when a lonely,
misunderstood water troll takes her down into his well.

Time for fun comes when the jolly tin peddler visits, or best of all,
when the fair comes to town. This is Laura Ingalls Wilder's
beloved story of how her husband Almanzo grew up as a farmer boy far
from the little house where Laura lived.

book_title: Little House in the Big Woods (Little House)
Summary:
And every night they are safe and warm in their little house, with the
happy sound of Pa's fiddle sending Laura and her sisters off to
sleep. And so begins Laura Ingalls Wilder's beloved story of a
pioneer girl and her family.

book_title: Little House in the Big Woods (Little House)
Summary:
And every night they are safe and warm in their little house, with the
happy sound of Pa's fiddle sending Laura and her sisters off to
sleep. And so begins Laura Ingalls Wilder's beloved story of a
pioneer girl and her family.

book_title: Little House on the Prairie (Little House)
Summary:
They travel for many days in their covered wagon until they find the
best spot to build their little house on the prairie. Soon they are
planting and plowing, hunting wild ducks and turkeys, and gathering
grass for their cows.

Finally a joyous Christmas is celebrated in a very unusual way in this
most exciting of all the Little House books.

book_title: On the Banks of Plum Creek (Little House)
Summary:
Misfortunes come in the form of a grasshopper plague and a terrible
blizzard, but the pioneer family works hard together to overcome these
troubles. And so continues Laura Ingalls Wilder's beloved story of
a pioneer girl and her family.

Jacob the shepherd follows his sheep into the sky, where Sirius the
dog star protects them from Lupus the wolf star while they graze on
the stars in the sky before returning home to sleep.

book_title: Morris the Moose (I Can Read Book 1)
Summary:
Morris, a mixed-up moose, has difficulties differentiating among his
animal colleagues and ultimately learns that not every animal is a
moose. Children's Choices for 1990 (IRA/CBC)

Laura has her first experiences as a teacher, and is courted by
Almanzo Wilder.

Nine-year-old Josh finds it impossible to get along with his
rambunctious eight-year-old stepbrother Jake, until an impending
change in their family unites them on a common front.

A young girl hears a noise in the forest near her family's farm in
Canada, and when she and her mother go to investigate, they find a
small fawn that seems to be all alone.

Mickey helps the bakers prepare morning cake during an unusual
nocturnal excursion.

book_title: If You Give a Pig a Pancake
Summary: If you give a pig a pancake, she'll want some syrup to go with it.

Centuries of wandering have taught the exiled dragon princess Shimmer
that humans are beneath her notice.

book_title: Billy the Ghost and Me (An I Can Read Chapter Book)
Summary:
Young Sarah, with the help of her friend Billy the Ghost, proves
herself as a deputy by planning the perfect capture of two bank
robbers in her Western town of Cactus Junction.

More traditional and modern-day stories of ghosts, witches, vampires,
"jump" stories, and scary songs.
Two friends share experiences.

Joe Sorby, a high school student of a future century, has a longing
for faraway places that eventually takes him to a life of hardship and
danger on the planet Mercury and in the Rings of Saturn.

Harry the dog goes to fantastic lengths to make his neighbor stop
singing.
There's never been another dog as delightful–or dirty–as Harry.

Harry the dog finds a graceful way to dispose of his new sweater with
roses on it.

book_title: Early Sorrow: Ten Stories of Youth
Summary:
Featuring works by E.L. Doctorow, Carson McCullers, Katherine
Mansfield, and seven other authors, this volume collects short stories
that exemplify the impact of early sorrow

book_title: Mr. Rabbit and the Lovely Present
Summary:
The author of such classics as My Granson Lew, Williams's Doll,
and Over and Over needs no introduction.

Arvie’s eccentric antics and wonderful word play keep the reader
laughing, but at its tender heart, the story reveals the holes left in
our lives when we lose the ones we love.

Thirteen-year-old Zinnia Taylor uncovers family secrets and self
truths while clearing a mysterious settler trail that begins on her
family's farm in Kentucky.

Sharon Creech's new fans will be thrilled to recognize Mary Lou
Finney and her infamous summer journal from their appearance in Walk
Two Moons. Here is the very journal that began the inquiry into
whether kisses taste like chicken!

book_title: Pickle in the Middle and Other Easy Snacks (An I Can Read Book)
Summary: Presents simple, no-cook snacks.

book_title: How to Talk to Your Dog (Talk to Your Pets)
Summary:
Jean Craighead George, award-winning author of over 80 books about
nature and animals, demonstrates in words and photos how to
communicate with your best friend. 01-01 TX Bluebonnet Award
Masterlist Children's Books 2000-NY Public Lib.

Rolie Polie Olie, a round robot living on a planet where everything is
round, enjoys a busy day with his family and then is too wired to go
to bed at night.

Amy has high hopes for the summer, but they fall flat when she
realizes that the other girl her age, Crystal, just doesnt want to be
friends.Its only when a kindly neighbor teaches Amy about the magic of
starfish that Amy finds a way to ...

Stories about nine remarkable young women include the tales of a girl
with two mothers, a girl who keeps a strange blue-skinned creature in
her closet, a rock star groupie, and a dancer who loves poetry and
moonlight picnics

The simple text and exquisite, detailed illustrations in this
beautiful book of months capture the cozy and distinctly feline
moments of a kitten as it grows, season, by season, into a cat.

Sabriel, daughter of the necromancer Abhorsen, must journey into the
mysterious and magical Old Kingdom to rescue her father from the Land
of the Dead.

In a savage postnuclear world, four young fugitives attempt to
overthrow the bloodthirsty rule of the Overlords with the help of
Shade, their mysterious mentor.

book_title: Whooo's Haunting the Teeny Tiny Ghost? (Teeny Tiny Ghost)
Summary:
A teeny tiny ghost who is having trouble learning how to be scary is
inspired by a Halloween visit from his ghost friends.

Little Bear's four adventures include taking a trip to the moon
and having a birthday party.
How can a fairy's blessing be such a curse?

In this novel based on the story of Cinderella, Ella struggles against
the childhood curse that forces her to obey any order given to her.

book_title: The Traitor : Golden Mountain Chronicles: 1885 (Golden Mountain Chronicles)
Summary:
In 1885, a lonely illegitimate American boy and a lonely Chinese
American boy develop an unlikely friendship in the midst of prejudices
and racial tension in their coal mining town of Rock Springs, Wyoming.

book_title: Back to School for Rotten Ralph
Summary:
Afraid of being left alone, Rotten Ralph, the nasty red cat, follows
Sarah to school and tries to prevent her from making new friends.

book_title: Kissing the Witch: Old Tales in New Skins
Summary:
In these fairy tales, women young and old tell their own stories of
love and hate, honor and revenge, passion and deception.

book_title: Red Scarf Girl : A Memoir of the Cultural Revolution
Summary:
Provides the story of Ji-li Jiang a twelve-year-old girl growing up in
China in 1966, the year that Chairman Mao launched the Cultural
Revolution, and the changes it brought to her and her family

When Santa Mouse's sleigh breaks down and his ratdeer desert him
in the middle of the forest, a little mouse named Rosie knows just
what to do to restore the spirit of Christmas.

Thirteen-year-old fraternal twins Dallas and Florida have grown up in

Half the fun of the NASCAR stock car circuit is traveling from race to
race.

book_title: Speed Demon (Nascar : Pole Position Adventures No. 4)
Summary:
Kin Travis is excited at the opportunity to work with Waddy
Peytona's pit crew, while Laura and Laptop try to come up with a
plan to help Aunt Adrian save a valuable painting from a gang of
international art thieves.

Tomorrow's the Seabreeze 250'-and Kin Travis only wants to
practice his new job as catch-can man for Waddy Peytona's team.

The disappearance of the Grail from young King Arthur's kingdom
has rained destruction down on England, but the king's mother and
Merlin will work to recover it. Reprint.

Two decades after an Indonesian uprising had decimated a family of
scientists, the two surviving children return as adults to investigate
bizarre reports of genetic mutations rising out of the war-shattered
region. Reprint.

book_title: Wing Commander: The Novel (Movie Universe, Book 1)
Summary: 600 Years in the Future the Battle for Earth is About to Begin.

book_title: Pilgrim Stars (Wing Commander: Movie Universe, Book 2)
Summary: Combat Alert In Deep Space!

book_title: Cat To The Dogs: A Joe Grey Mystery
Summary:
A recent earthquake was only the beginning of the big trouble that
plagues Molena Point, California.
Crispin is a mosaicist, a layer of bright tiles.

book_title: Vampire Diaries #3: The Fury (Vampire Diaries, No 3)
Summary:
Damon Mocking Stefan and Elena, he laughs in the face of doom. Elena
Wild with her craving for blood, she confronts the ultimate evil. The
terrifying story of two vampire brothers and the beautiful girl torn
between them.

The Eternal One At our human limits, when we've gone as far as
flesh and imagination can take us, meet the Eternal One.

book_title: Beyond the Stars : Quest for Tomorrow #4 (Quest for Tomorrow, 4)
Summary: A new life...or is it"?

Faith, Winnie, and K.C.--three hometown best friends--share their
first year at college together as the exciting college guys threaten
Faith's relationship with her high school sweetheart.

book_title: With Friends Like These, Who Needs Enemies (Three-of-a-Kind, No 1)
Summary:
After spending years together at the Willoughby Hall Home for
Children, Cat, Josie, and Becka face the prospects of being separated
when the Morgans arrive looking for a daughter to adopt. Original.

Freshman year college adventures continue for three hometown best
friends as Faith's preppie roommate, Lauren, schemes to get
herself kicked out of an elite sorority with the help of the
tantalizingly dangerous Dash Ramirez.

All the girls at Cresswell High want the handsome, rich, and smart
Brad Forester, but when Cassie Arthur lands him, she soon realizes
that evil lurks behind his dreamy exterior and that dating him may
cost her life.

When debate team newcomer Skip Masters dies in a bizarre initiation
rite, his girlfriend vows to find his killer, certain that another
debate team member is to blame.

book_title: Homes a Nice Place to Visit, but I Wouldn't Want to Live There (Three of a Kind, No 2)
Summary:
When the Morgans adopt three girls from the same orphanage, Josie,
Cat, and Becka each react differently to being part of a family.

Campus calendar girl KC struggles with her new-found fame, Winnie
wonders how to fend off a persistent suitor, and Lauren is caught by
her boyfriend kissing another man.

book_title: Will the Real Becka Morgan Please Stand Up? (3 of a Kind No 3)
Summary:
Becka bends over backwards to become the most popular girl in school,
making life miserable for herself and her new adoptive sisters.

Alyssa, in search of a romance to heal her broken heart, and Megan, a
fun-loving cheerleader, encourage their bookish friend Gabrielle to
begin a romance with a lifeguard.

After a plane crash, seven misfit boys find themselves stranded on a
subtropical island where a dark force stalks them, even as they
struggle to return to civilization.

book_title: Two's Company, Four's a Crowd (Three of a Kind, No 4)
Summary:
Cat and Becka try to set up shy Josie with Red for the Green Falls
Junior High Dance.

book_title: 101 Ways to Win Homecoming Queen (Three of a Kind, No 6)
Summary:
Determined to raise her pal Marla's spirits, Cat agrees to help
her win the Homecoming Queen crown, but when she herself is nominated,
it becomes a bitter popularity contest that could ruin their
friendship.

Cathy is heartbroken when her boyfriend Larry dumps her for another
girl and kicks her out of his rock band, and when band members begin
to die off, people begin to wonder how far Cathy will go for revenge.
Reprint.

When Michael's old girlfriend Beth begins dating Renee's
brother Vincent, Renee finally feels certain that Michael is over
Beth, until Vincent and Beth are in a motorcycle accident and Beth
relies on Michael for support.

The girls of the freshman dorm face a new set of challenges when
KC's relationship with Peter is threatened by jealousy, Lauren
faces financial problems that could force her to move off campus, and
Kimberly faces performance pressure.
Is Wonder's racing career over before it begins?
Ashleigh's determined to make her dreams come true.

Cathy Atmore may not be popular or pretty enough to make the
cheerleading squad by trying out, but she may get her pompoms by
default when the girls on the squad begin to turn up dead, one by one.
Reprint. Originally published: c1991.

Freshmen Courtney Connor, KC, and Winnie struggle through romance and
other problems as they enjoy their first year at college.

Joanie's date for the Homecoming Dance, the popular and handsome
Kyle Carpenter, brings her sudden popularity, but it could cost her
her friendship with glamorous Brooke Stevenson.

Stefan Haunted by his tragic past, he struggled to resist her passion.
Damon Driven by revenge, he hunted the brother who betrayed him. The
terrifying story of two vampire brothers and the beautiful girl torn
between them.

book_title: The Struggle (The Vampire Diaries : a Trilogy, Vol II)
Summary:
Elena Irresistibly drawn to both brothers, her choice will decide
their fate. The terrifying story of two vampire brothers and the
beautiful girl torn between them.

Tired of being caught in the middle of a love triangle between two
vampire brothers, Elena sacrifices an immortal love to end the
brothers' constant strife.

Haunted by recurring nightmares, high school junior Sharon Anders
begins to confuse dreams with reality and is soon plunged into a
desperate struggle between good and evil.

Cory has recurring dreams about Chrissie's death and is somehow in
possession of her blood-stained bracelet, but he could not have killed
her because the only tracks around her body were animal tracks.

Kate Gillespie, a homicide inspector with the San Francisco Police
Department, is drawn into a deadly conspiracy involving corrupt cops,
dirty deals, her own troubled family history, and murder after she
witnesses the killing of one of her ...

Faith, Liza, and Melissa struggle through challenges with difficult
parents, wild boyfriends, and fame-hungry ambitions.

As Melissa and Brooks approach the altar, Winnie and Josh promise to
abandon their wild ways, and KC finds herself desperate and alone in a
dangerous situation. Original.

Minnesota natives Brandon and Brenda Walsh discover love and
heartbreak at their new school in Beverly Hills. Original. TV tie-in.

Winnie cheats on her boyfriend, Lauren hopes to reunite with hers, KC
vows to follow Peter to Europe, and Liza antagonizes her roommate with
her wild antics, in the continuing adventures of freshmen girls trying
to survive in college.

Lauren becomes the meal ticket for a con artist; KC strays from her
real friends in an attempt to become popular; and Melissa and Brooks
anxiously await their wedding day in the seventeenth volume of the
Freshman Dorm series. Original.

Once again, the year's finest flights of speculative imagination
are gathered in one extraordinary volume, compiled by acclaimed editor
and anthologist David G. Hartwell.

book_title: Beverly Hills 90210: Two Hearts (Beverly Hills, 90210, No 7)
Summary:
As the winter doldrums set in at West Beverly High, Brandon falls for
a beautiful figure skater, Brenda has the hots for an older guy in her
exercise class, and Dylan is pursued by a friend from the past.
Original. TV tie-in.

Brenda's parents forbid her to see Dylan, Kelly prepares to leave
for Paris, and Brandon may be expecting too much of his job at the
Beach Club.

After Garth shares the secrets of his ancestry with Miranda, his one
true love, Miranda becomes intoxicated by this newfound knowledge and
is tempted by the promise of unlimited power. Original.

While Garth, the victim of an ancient spell, searches desperately for
the key that will free him from his family's ancient secrets,
Miranda eludes the secret admirer who is dogging her path. Original.

Determined to fight his legacy of darkness and evil, Garth, along with
Miranda, is lured into a deadly ceremony performed by the mysterious
Featherwoman. Original.

Ashleigh Griffen, the jockey for Wonder's Pride, and her friend
Samantha McLean are certain that the horse will suffer irreparable
damage if he is raced in the strenuous three-race Triple Crown.
Original.

Certain that the wild and rebellious colt Sierra could be a great
racehorse, Samantha McLean, the daughter of Whitebrook Farm's
trainer, begins to train Sierra for the dangerous demands of
steeplechasing. Original.

On vacation in Paris, the girls are horrified when Lauren is
kidnapped, and soon KC, Kimberly, and Winnie begin to wonder if their
beaux are responsible for the kidnapping scheme.

Four children set out to rescue a sorceress held captive in a parallel
world.

United in their search for a great sorceress who is humankind's
only hope for salvation, four children travel to San Francisco to
search for their protector and elude the evil power of a stolen ruby.
Reprint.

Talli McAlister is convinced that her school's new principal, who
has been hired to put an end to gang violence, is up to no good when
the school's biggest troublemakers begin disappearing without a
trace. Original.

A chilling thriller that forms part of the Bone Chillers series of
stories for children.

Susan is thrilled to meet Drew--he is tall, handsome, and bright--but
when strange things start occurring in Susan's town, she fears
that she may have fallen in love with a vampire. Original.

book_title: Ben's in Love (Boyfriends and Girlfriends, No 4)
Summary: A blind teen falls in love with two girls. Making Out.

Talli McAlister, who recently drove a stake through the heart of
Westerberg High's vampire principal, is being stalked by the
creepy new substitute teacher. Original.

Zooey used to think her family was perfect and her parents were really
in love, but what she saw has changed all that and made her think
about love--and her boyfriends and girlfriends--in a different way.
Original.

Becoming lost in an isolated mountain town, Hallie and her friends are
charmed by Holyoake's old-fashioned customs and friendly ways
until they realize that the people there have no intention of letting
them leave. Original.

Planning to dress up like Pilgrims during the Thanksgiving
celebration, Kyle and Annie prepare stovepipe hats, pies, and a
turkey, until the evil Frankenturkey makes them run for their lives.
Original.

When KC, Winnie, Faith, and Courtney take a wild ride through the
Southwest during spring break, Winnie's flirting leads the group
into a tangled web of danger and romance. Original.

As eerie happenings terrify K.C., Winnie, Faith, Courtney, and the
rest of the Freshman Dorm crowd, the girls begin to wonder if the
fraternities are playing pranks or if the spirit of a dead fraternity
pledge has returned to seek revenge.

Winter break is filled with romance as Winnie and Josh stay at the
same ski resort and possibly save their marriage, KC falls for a
mystery man, and Faith finds David--but his secret may keep them
apart. Original.

book_title: Zoey Fools Around (Boyfriends and Girlfriends, No 1)
Summary:
New couples are formed, friends turn into enemies, and secrets are
unearthed when Zoey enters the lives of a group of friends who have
all grown up together on their tiny island home. Original.

After recovering from a dangerous, career-threatening injury, Pride
faces a new challenge when the Townsends scheme to stop the horse from
racing, and it is up to Samantha to save Pride. Original.

When a sinister killer begins seeking revenge on babysitters, Karin is
not scared, even after her best friend dies, because she thinks she
knows the killer's game.

Kate wants desperately to rekindle her romance with Justin, Chelsea
and Connor need to save their rocky marriage, and Grace's passion
for David forces her to return--only love could bring them back to
Ocean City for the hottest summer ever.

book_title: There Was an Old Woman (Nursery Crimes)
Summary:
Moving out of their stuffy dorm room into what seems to be the perfect
apartment, roommates Candace and Ellie are alarmed by rumors that a
local psychopath is murdering off-campus students. Original.

Mara Kreiger, an overweight loner always lurking in the background,
suddenly snaps when the coolest kids in school steal her idea for a
bake sale and she is determined to make them regret it--even if it
kills them. Original.

Horrified by her vampire legacy, Anne Marie Montclair is terrified
when her twin brother, Paul, is seduced by a beautiful vampire and
drawn into the dark and bloody world of their vampire father.
Original.

Struggling to cope with their dark vampire legacy, Anne Marie
Montclair grieves over her mother's tragic death, while her twin
brother, Paul, is torn between his love for his sister and his hatred
toward the father who had abandoned him.

Ashleigh Griffen is expecting her first child after the New Year, but
on Christmas Eve, as she visits the stables to give treats to her
favorite horses, a stallion's kick puts her life and her baby in
jeopardy. Original.

Struggling with her work as the editor for the Fairview High
newspaper, student Virginia Wells becomes alarmed when a reporter
disappears just before the newspaper is sabotaged and Virginia herself
finds a threatening message. Original.

A series of freak accidents cause seventeen-year-old Lydia to suspect
that someone is trying to kill her, and when auditions for the annual
school production are announced, Lydia fears her time may be running
out. Original.

Julie is delighted to finally meet her long-lost twin sister, Joanna,
but she soon discovers that Joanna refuses to share Julie with anyone
else--even if she has to kill to keep her to herself. Original.

Anne Marie, tormented by her brother's monstrous transformation,
fights for control of her life as her brother, hunted by those who
know his terrible secret, seeks his father's lethal protection.
Original.

Kate finds her romantic Caribbean cruise thwarted by a seductive
stowaway, while Chelsea is upset when Connor's novel starts taking
precedence over her and Grace recovers from David's desertion by
dating two new guys. Original.

A retelling, based on the movie script, of the adventures of Mowgli, a
young boy raised by animals in the Indian jungle.

Discovering a diary that she kept as a girl while growing up on her
parents' farm, champion rider Ashleigh Griffin relives memories of
the horses she once loved, including a spirited colt stolen by horse
thieves.

Working at Pine Lake Park despite their fear of the local curse of the
blood moon, Kate and her best friend Al find their nightmares coming
true when a young man is killed just before the arrival of the evil
magician Max Kettering.

Moira, a teenage baby-sitter, becomes embroiled in a deadly
confrontation with an evil, seemingly unstoppable force that threatens
to destroy her. Original.

Hating her boring school, her pain-in-the-neck little brother, and
even her best friend, Tori searches for something fun and finds a
mysterious notebook that contains hilariously gruesome spells.
Original.

Kate becomes suspicious of the sultry Allegra, who seeks protection
from a deceitful past in the arms of a new roommate, while Grace makes
her decision between Carr the hunk and Wilton the brain. Original.

The ultimate test of Kate and Justin's love comes in the form of a
fatal accident, while Allegra desperately searches for a place to stay
and Grace overcomes her feelings for David with Wilton, unaware that
he may pose a threat to her.
All the kids like the new teacher except Joey and Nate.

Remaining in New Orleans with Jean-Paul despite her growing fears
about the city's dark side, Alison James is propelled by haunting
nightmares into a magic circle that threatens to overtake her.
Original.

There's a special new turkey in the pen behind Annie and
Kyle's house.

Stranded at an inn during a blizzard, Matt enjoys the snow and the
time off from school, until he learns that the innkeeper and all the
other guests are really aliens who have come to Earth to study human
life. Original.

book_title: Attack of the Killer Ants (BC 9) (Bone Chillers)
Summary:
The school picnic is crawling with ants. So Ryan and Alex step on them
and drown them. They think they've seen the last of the ants--
until something big and ugly and hairy follows them home.

Jeremy Wilson's mucus is taking over the town, and if he
doesn't figure out how to stop the goop, the whole town will drown
in slime.

Anticipating her adoption into the loving McLean family at Whitebrook
Farm, Cindy Blake finds her worst nightmares coming true when her
adoption is not approved and her favorite horse, Glory, is put up for
sale. Original.

A series of practical jokes takes a deadly turn on Mattie
Sullivan's seventeenth birthday when she finds a corpse in the
lighthouse on St. Simon's Island and later receives a life-
threatening note. Original.

Joining a group of elite New York City computer hackers, Dade Murphy
is drawn into a mystery when Joey, the youngest member of the gang, is
arrested by the Secret Service for a computer crime that none of them
committed.

If Glory could win the Breeders' Cup Classic, he would become a
legend like his famous grandsire, Just Victory.

Share the adventures of Odysseus, the most heroic of the ancient Greek
warriors, as he returns home to Ithaca after the Trojan War.

book_title: Wishbone Classic #03 Romeo and Juliet (Wishbone Classics)
Summary:
A young reader's introduction to the famous Shakespearean tragic
romance follows the endeavors of Romeo and Juliet, who enter into a
relationship that is forbidden by their feuding families and who
pursue a doomed marriage. Original.

book_title: Wishbone Classic #04 Joan of Arc (Wishbone Classics)
Summary:
When a peasant girl named Joan leads the French in a battle against
brutal English invaders, powerful men convince her followers that she
is not a hero but instead a witch who must be destroyed, and she must
fight the battle for her life ...

An adaptation of Dickens's story of the orphan forced to practice
thievery and live a life of crime in nineteenth-century London.

book_title: Wishbone Classic #06 Adv of Robin Hood (Wishbone Classics)
Summary:
Recounts the life and adventures of Robin Hood, who, with his band of
followers, lived in Sherwood Forest as an outlaw dedicated to fighting
tyranny.

Four very different people from four dissimilar neighborhoods, Sara,
Max, Dagger, and Kyle, teen volunteers at an urban hospital, learn
that friendship and hard work can overcome any problems and
unhappiness in life. Original.

Flushing her chemistry experiment down the toilet just before her
brother flushes his dead goldfish, Ellie is horrified when a sinister
creature emerges from the plumbing and seeks to take over the
bathroom. Original.

book_title: Terminal Case of the Uglies, A (BC 14) (Bone Chillers)
Summary:
Eric Ross, the least attractive kid in school, is too ugly to be
included in the photograph that a famous talent agent takes of all his
classmates, who contract a disfiguring disease after the picture is
taken. Original.

book_title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame (Enchanted Tales, No 3)
Summary:
The Pompous Captain of the Guard, Jean-Claude pledges to get rid of
the beautiful, gypsy dancer from the city for merrymaking and refusing
his flirtatious advances, but she finds safety and friendship in
Quasimodo, the ugly hunchback who ...

book_title: Tiki Doll of Doom (Haynes, Betsy. Bone Chillers, No. 15.)
Summary:
Receiving a Hawaiian necklace from her aunt, Lucy begins to experience
strange dreams that come true, and as the dreams increase in weirdness
and intensity, she fears she cannot get rid of the necklace. Original.

book_title: Queen of the Gargoyles, The  (BC 16) (Bone Chillers)
Summary:
The latest installment in a series that is the basis of a Saturday
morning cartoon finds Isabella having second thoughts about her
attraction to gargoyles after the kids in her building begin to
disappear. Original.

book_title: Why I Quit the Baby-sitters Club (BC 17) (Bone Chillers)
Summary:
Rosie receives an unexpected--and unwelcome--surprise when she finally
meets the Pendreds' baby, which has always been asleep when she
arrived a their house to baby-sit, and discovers that the hungry
little beast has a taste for baby ...

Jason begins to lose control of the story he is writing on his
computer, when Blowtorch, the main character, tries to escape from
jail against Jason's wishes.

Paul faces a foul-tempered parrot with the power to make the worst
things happen.

Lexi knows there's something weird about Julie, the new girl in
school, worse than her affinity for eating insects. She suspects that
Julie intends to have a feeding frenzy--with Lexi's best friend
Fitz as the main course!

Finally Leslie's parents give Battlecry a chance to prove his
worth. Leslie doesn't know that by entering Battlecry in a race,
she'll risk losing him forever.
Can Susan ever ride again?

Sure that the horse she has trained is on his way to becoming a
champion, Cindy is shattered when the horse contracts an incurable and
highly contagious disease for which he must be euthanized. Original.

When her sister suffers an accident similar to the one that ended her
mother's life, Samantha experiences troubling memories and begins
to relive the traumatic events that followed her mother's death in
a riding accident.

book_title: Wishbone Classic #09 A Journey to the Center of the  Earth (Wishbone)
Summary:
A retelling of the Jules Verne classic in which a group of people
journey into the crater of a volcano to find the center of the earth.

book_title: Wishbone Classic #10 The Red Badge of Courage (Wishbone)
Summary:
In the spring of 1863, while engaged in the fierce battle of
Chancellorsville in Virginia, a young Union soldier matures to manhood
and finds peace of mind as he comes to grips with his conflicting
emotions about war.

book_title: Wishbone Classic #11 Adv of Tom Sawyer (Wishbone)
Summary:
The adventures of a mischievous young boy and his friends growing up
in a Mississippi River town in the nineteenth century..

When Molly, Ariel, Toby, and Isabelle pledge the coolest sorority on
campus, they discover that fitting in is sometimes difficult but
together they can overcome anything, in this second book to a new
series. Original.

Determined to win a high-level competition, Christina Reese ponders
whether she may be pushing her prized new horse, Sterling Dream, too
far when the grey mare balks at jumping even the lowest fences.
Original.
600 Years in the Future the Battle for Earth is About to Begin.

When Ashleigh's favorite yearling is injured in a terrible
accident, Ashleigh feels responsible, and when the vet says the colt
should be put down, Ashleigh begs for time and devotes herself to
caring for the yearling.

Spinout! Kin Travis can't imagine anything better than working in
the pits for NASCAR's Seabreeze 250 -- especially since he's
on the same team as his hero, driver Waddy Peytona.

When Christina meets Parker Townsend, who has advanced to training
level, she becomes even more determined to prove that she and her
horse Sterling are ready for training level, too.

book_title: It's a Twin Thing (Two of a Kind, No. 1)
Summary: Mary-Kate and Ashley think they are too old to have a babysitter.

book_title: The Sleepover Secret (Two of a Kind, No. 3)
Summary:
Surprise! What a blast! Ashley is having a sleepover--and Jennifer
Dilber, the most popular girl in school, is coming! Ashley works
super-hard to make sure her party will be perfect. She doesn't
want any surprises.

book_title: Two of a Kind #05: To Snoop or Not to Snoop? (Two of a Kind)
Summary:
When their father buys a new telescope to learn about the stars, Mary-
Kate and Ashley decide to use it instead to spy on their neighbors,
but the spying turns serious when the twins see something they
shouldn't. Original.

book_title: Two of a Kind #06: My Sister the Supermodel (Two of a Kind)
Summary:
Reel Teen magazine is coming to her school to pick their model of the
month, and Ashley just knows they're going to pick her. But when
the big day comes--the winner is Mary-Kate! Oh, no! Now what is Ashley
going to do?

book_title: Two of a Kind #07: Two's a Crowd (Two of a Kind)
Summary:
Mary-Kate thought her twin sister Ashley would be her best friend
forever. But now Ashley has a new best friend! Ashley's spending
all her time with Nicole, and Mary-Kate feels totally left out.

book_title: Let's Party! (Two of a Kind, No. 8)
Summary:
Ashley has a great idea! She's going to give a surprise party for
her friend Jennifer. But Ashley gets a surprise, too -- when she finds
out that Mary-Kate is giving another party for her best friend Amanda
on the same night!

book_title: Two of a Kind #09: Calling All Boys (Two of a Kind, 9)
Summary:
When Mary-Kate and Ashley head off to boarding school, their father
gives them each a diary to help them make the transition easier.

book_title: Two of a Kind #10: Winner Take All (Two of a Kind)
Summary:
I never even made it to the first base. I missed a fly ball. And I
struck out--six times in a row! But that's not the worst thing.
Ashley is the new gossip columnist for the school paper--and she wrote
something about me.

book_title: Two of a Kind #12: The Cool Club (Two of a Kind)
Summary:
When a new student at White Oak Academy forms a secret club and asks
Mary-Kate and Ashley to join, the sisters discover that joining the
cool crowd comes at the expense of abandoning their own friends.

book_title: New Adventures of Mary-Kate & Ashley #10 The Case Of The Great Elephant Escape : The Case Of The Great Elephant Escape (New Adventures of Mary-Kate & Ashley)
Summary:
When Maysie, the baby elephant, disappears only two hours before the
circus is due to start, the twins are sure it can't be too
difficult to find where such a big animal could be hidden.

book_title: The Case of the Summer Camp Caper (The New Adventures of Mary-Kate & Ashley, No. 11)
Summary:
When Mary-Kate and Ashley go away to camp, someone tries to frame
Mary-Kate for a series of thefts, and she must rely on her sister
Ashley to clear her of the blame.

book_title: New Adventures of Mary-Kate & Ashley #12: The Case Of The Surfing Secret : The Case Of The Surfing Secret (New Adventures of Mary-Kate & Ashley)
Summary:
The trenchcoat twins learn to surf while on vacation in Southern
California, but when a friend seems to have a few too many wipeouts,
the twins search for a surfboard saboteur. Original.

book_title: The Case of the Green Ghost (The New Adventures of Mary-Kate & Ashley #13)
Summary:
"Mary-Kate and Ashley -- I dare you to go into the haunted
house!" It was Halloween, and our friend Patty was trying to
scare us. Ashley and I didn't believe in ghosts, so we took
Patty's dare.

book_title: The Case of the Big Scare Mountain Mystery (New Adventures of Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen, No. 14)
Summary:
Ashley and I were on a ski vacation, and we couldn't wait to hit
the slopes -- until we heard the scary legend of Ski Mountain.
According to the story, a monster snatched a boy right off the ski
slopes! The boy was never seen again.

book_title: New Adventures of Mary-Kate & Ashley #16: The Case of the Rock Star's Secret : The Case of the Rock Star's Secret (New Adventures of Mary-Kate & Ashley)
Summary:
When legendary rocker Johnny Sparkle's instrument collection
suddenly goes missing, the twins are on a mission to find it and bring
the culprit to justice. Original.

book_title: The Case of the Cheerleading Camp Mystery (The New Adventures of Mary-Kate & Ashley #17)
Summary:
When someone begins to sabotage Ashley at cheerleader camp, she and
her sister Mary-Kate decide to investigate.

book_title: The Case of the Flying Phantom (New Adventures of Mary-Kate & Ashley, No. 18)
Summary:
When Mary-Kate and Ashley visit the Museum of Early Air Travel in
Washington D.C., they are told that one of the planes in the museum is
haunted and that leads them to one of their scariest cases yet.

book_title: The Case of the Creepy Castle (The New Adventures of Mary-Kate & Ashley, No. 19)
Summary:
When Halloween arrives and Ashley and Mary-Kate don't have a
mystery to solve, they begin to worry, but before they know it they
are surrounded by werewolves and vampires and their friends are
suddenly disappearing.

book_title: The Case of the Golden Slipper (The New Adventures of Mary Kate & Ashley, No. 20)
Summary:
The twins receive invitations to Princess Glorianna's royal ball,
but before the big event the princess disappears, and the only clues
are the gold slipper outside her window and a threatening note.

Thirteen-year-old Christina Reese dreams of becoming an event rider,
but it is not until she is forced to care for an orphaned colt that
she discovers the way to make this happen. Original.

Head Hunting When Leonard Betts's body disappears from the morgue
after being decapitated in a violent accident, Special Agents Mulder
and Scully are called in to investigate the situation.

Recounts the life and rise to success of the popular singer, and
describes her music and her likes and dislikes

book_title: Ashleigh #8: The Lost Foal (Thoroughbred Ashleigh, No 8)
Summary:
When Shadow, the filly she watched being born, disappears, Ashleigh is
devastated and vows to continue the search indefinitely.

book_title: Two of a Kind #14: Bye-bye Boyfriend (Two of a Kind, 14)
Summary:
Ashley is excited for her sister--until she finds out that Mary-Kate

empty big green pocketbook—just like her mother’s—and along the way
collects pieces of her day to put inside, inventing stories for each

A grandmother explains to her granddaughter how the arrival of winter
brings changes in nature and the earth's creatures, and how the

Judith Sutton's beautiful paintings bring one of Dolly
Parton's best-loved songs to life. "The heartfelt verses are
imbued with the same genuine, infectiously likeable spirit Parton
herself projects."'Publishers Weekly.

In this first Frances book, the little badger adroitly delays her
bedtime with requests for kisses and milk, and concerns over tigers
and giants and things going bump in the night.

Charlotte Zolotow's lyrical prose and Stefano Vitale's rich
illustrations make this a beautiful celebration of the cycle of life.

Buz eventually makes his escape, only to discover he has caught a bug
of his own. On with the chase!

book_title: Inch by Inch : The Garden Song (Trophy Picture Book)
Summary:
' This picture book version of a favorite popular song charts the
faithful progress of a young boy who overcomes every obstacle'rock
and weeds and a hungry old crow'and makes his garden overflow with
bounty.

Diego and his family are migrant farmers who move from state to state
picking fruits and vegetables.

Rhythmic, rhyming verse by Sheena Knowles and hilarious illustrations
by Rod Clement make this an entertaining picture book that is sure to
find a place in the hearts of readers everywhere.

When the time comes for Livingstone Mouse to find a nest of his own,
he wants it to be in the best place.

book_title: I Have Heard of a Land (Trophy Picture Book)
Summary:
I have heard of a land Where the imagination has no fences Where what
is dreamed one night Is accomplished the next day/FONT In the late
1880s, signs went up all around America - land was free in the
Oklahoma territory.

Thenthe letter arrived, changing Ben's life, and changing his
family in unexpected ways. And there was the birthday room... 00
Riverbank Review Magazine's Children's Books of Distinction

book_title: A Bargain for Frances (I Can Read Book 2)
Summary:
When she tricks Frances into buying her tea set, it's the last

A little boy is surprised and pleased when one of the dinosaurs from
the museum agrees to play with him.

book_title: Little Bear (An I Can Read Book)
Summary:
Meet Little Bear, a friend to millions of children. And meet Mother

snowy outside, she finds just the right outfit for Little Bear to play
in.

"The world's greatest detective" follows the clues that

"The character of Big Max, a kind of miniature Sherlock Holmes,

Because Stanley does not act like his fellow cavemen, they chase him
away. But then Stanley invents the house'and becomes a hero'in
this thought-provoking, funny story about an early nonconformist.

When Papa's seven little mouse boys ask for a bedtime story, Papa
does even better than that—he tells seven stories, one for each boy!

book_title: Father Bear Comes Home (I Can Read Book 1)
Summary:
Little Bear and his friends are on hand to welcome Father Bear home

book_title: No Fighting, No Biting! (An I Can Read Book, Level 2)
Summary:
The merry adventures of two scrapping alligator children—and of Rosa

book_title: Come Back Amelia Bedelia an I Can Read (An I Can Read Book)

For use in schools and libraries only. A literal-minded housekeeper

Summary:
The four members of the Private Eyes Club—Skinny, Wizard, Snitch, and

Summary:

Summary:
Best Friends Frog and Toad are always together. Here are five

book_title: Little Bear's Visit (I Can Read Book 1)
Summary:
‘Mrs. Minarik is at her superb best in depicting the charming

—H.
0scar Otter builds his very own slide, far up in the mountains.

book_title: The Case of the Hungry Stranger (An I Can Read Book)
Summary:
When this book was first published, The Horn Book praised its

book_title: The Case of the Dumb Bells (An I Can Read Book)
Summary: Doorbells are mysteriously ringing all over the neighborhood.

Daniel is hurt when others laugh at his wood carving, until he learns

book_title: Arthur's Pen Pal (I Can Read Book 2)
Summary: Arthur thinks his pen pal is more fun than his little sister.

book_title: Arthur's Honey Bear (I Can Read Book 2)

Arthur and his sister Violet are selling all their old toys in a Tag

book_title: Owl at Home (I Can Read Book 2)
Summary:

Now young children can read about dinosaurs'even how to say their

Summary:
Pickles is a young cat with big paws and big plans. But all he can

Summary:
"El Monstruo!" Every day is the same for Pablo's father.

Weasel is ready for his dinner, and poor Mouse is it. Can he stop the

The stars of the Big Dipper have led a runaway slave family to Deacon

book_title: Arthur's Funny Money (I Can Read Book 2)
Summary:
Simple business concepts are ingeniously woven into the story. This

book_title: Arthur's Prize Reader (I Can Read Books (Harper Hardcover))
Summary:
Arthur is sure he will win the Super Chimp Comics contest. He's

Little Bear meets Emily, a human girl, and her doll. 'Once again

Free people, Free land The Muldie boys and their father have come a

book_title: The Big Balloon Race (I Can Read Book)
Summary:
The thrills of Ariel's first ride in a hydrogen balloon come to

book_title: Arthur's Christmas Cookies (I Can Read Book 2)
Summary:
Arthur decides to make Mother and Father special Christmas cookies as

Grizzwold the lovable bear is having a tough time finding somewhere to

He's not even any good as a live bearskin rug! Will Grizzwold ever

Frog and Toad enjoy spending their days together. They fly kites,

book_title: Frog and Toad All Year (I Can Read Book 2)
Summary:
Friends all year. In winter, spring, summer, and fall, Frog and Toad

When his parents go out hunting, Johnny Lion stays home and reads his

book_title: Red Fox and His Canoe (I Can Read Book 1)
Summary:
And when he gets it, he's off to catch a million fish. But Red Fox
gets more than he bargained for in his roomy new canoe -- a bear and

room left for Red Fox!
Harold becomes a part of the picture he is drawing for his room

Summary:
Arthur the chimp is a little worried about losing his loose tooth,

book_title: Grasshopper on the Road (I Can Read Book 2)
Summary:
As Grasshopper sets out to follow a road, he meets some unusual

Summary:
"We will go to America!" It is 1868, and Carl Erik's

Meet the silliest family in the world! Grandpa Brown tries to hatch a

‘These thirty-eight poems offer beginning readers a chance to try some
verse.

book_title: George the Drummer Boy (I Can Read Book 3)

George had no idea that this was the start of the American Revolution.
In this I Can Read Book, Don Bolognese's vibrant pictures capture

Summary:
"Get your gun!" Sam's father said. "The British

Sam was ready in a minute. Father and son rushed to the village green.
Other Minutemen were already there.

book_title: No More Monsters for Me! (I Can Read Book 1)
Summary:
Guess what's growing in the basement . . . A baby monster!
Minneapolis Simpkin is hiding it down there. But a monster is a hard

No mud! Small Pig loves to sit in good, soft mud. When the
farmer's wife cleans his pigpen, Small Pig runs away. In the city
he finds a new mud puddle—but it is not full of mud at all. And now
Small Pig has one big problem!

book_title: Aunt Eater Loves a Mystery (I Can Read Book 2)
Summary:
CenterFour Aunt Eater Mysteries! A stolen traveling bag . . . A
mysterious black shadow on the wall . . . A thief next door . . . A

book_title: The Josefina Story Quilt (I Can Read Book 3)
Summary:
California, here we come!Faith's Pa says there's no room on a

book_title: Lulu and the Witch Baby (I Can Read)
Summary:
Lulu Witch begins to change her mind about her pesky baby sister when

Westward ho! The Golly Sisters are heading west. They've got new

book_title: Clara and the Bookwagon (I Can Read Book 3)
Summary:
" But when the traveling bookwagon, with persuasive Miss Mary at

Summary:
Porcupine invites Otter and Owl to sleep over. Otter takes care of the

book_title: Morris and Boris at the Circus (I Can Read Book 1)
Summary:
Morris the Moose has never been to the circus, so his friend Boris

Greg makes fascinating discoveries about things he finds at home when

book_title: Mrs. Brice's Mice (An I Can Read Book, Level 1)
Summary: Among Mrs.

Amelia Bedelia, the housekeeper with a literal mind, merrily upsets

book_title: Smallest Cow in the World (I Can Read)

Four peasant ladies discover that too many cooks without a plan can

book_title: Thank You, Amelia Bedelia (I Can Read Book 2)

This new edition is sure to please every fan of Amelia

"Though the words [in this collection of free-verse poems] are

book_title: Grandmas at the Lake (I Can Read Book 2)

The adult-child negotiations get a lift from McCully's visual

master."BL.

As timely as when it was first published in 1972, this poignant story

book_title: Rollo and Tweedy and the Ghost at Dougal Castle (I Can Read Book 2)
Summary:
"If Holmes and Watson had been mice, they would have been Tweedy

book_title: Zack's Alligator (An I Can Read Book)

When Bridget the alligator arrives in the mail, she's only the

Inaugurated with Else Holmelund Minarik'S LITTLE BEAR, illustrated

Two boys. Two balloons. Each boy thinks his balloon is best. What do

A little boy wants to play with his dog, Digby. His sister says Digby

Summary:

Summary:
The fat cat sat on the mat. "Get off!" said the rat. But the

Summary:
In this new edition, complete with full-color art, Alice Low has

book_title: Emma's Yucky Brother (I Can Read Book 3)
Summary:
In Jean Little's warmhearted, perceptive story about adoption,
Emma learns that there is more to having a little brother than she had
ever guessed -- and that in order to get the brother she wants, she
must first learn to be the sister he ...

three mysteries for their insect friends, in an amusing easy-to-read

book_title: Marvin's Best Christmas Present Ever (I Can Read Book 3)

book_title: Stuart Finds His Way Home (Stuart Little Movie Tie-In)
Summary:
Chased Away When the Littles bring their new son home, their cat,

book_title: The Bug in Teacher's Coffee : And Other School Poems (I Can Read Book 2)
Summary:
What really goes on at school! Funny poems and pictures explore the

book_title: Amelia Bedelia 4 Mayor (I Can Read Book 2)
Summary: The race is on!

book_title: Biscuit Wants to Play (My First I Can Read)

Biscuit doesn't give up, though, and soon the kittens find out

Summary:
Young stargazers learn about different star colors and brightnesses,

people to look at stars and ...

book_title: What Happens to a Hamburger (Let's Read and Find Out)
Summary: What happens to a hamburger and all the other food we eat?

Briefly introduces various types of dinosaurs whose skeletons and
reconstructions are seen in museums and explains how scientists
uncover, preserve, and study fossilized dinosaur bones.

book_title: My Visit to the Dinosaurs (Let's-Read-and-Find-Out Science 2)
Summary:
Dinosaurs are extinct now, but you can visit dinosaur skeletons in a
museum.

book_title: Air Is All Around You (Let's-Read-and-Find-Out Science 1)
Summary:
Describes the various properties of air and shows how to prove that
air takes up space and that there is air dissolved in water.

book_title: Is There Life in Outer Space (Let's Read and Find Out)
Summary:
Franklyn M. Branley's fascinating text and Edward Miller's
zany illustrations tap into kids' curiosity to give a dazzling
tour of life out among the stars.

book_title: The Moon Seems to Change (Let's-Read-and-Find-Out Science 2)
Summary: Because the moon revolves around Earth, it seems to grow and shrink.
How do we know what dinosaurs were like?
How do you learn what the world is like?

Learn all about what a skeleton can do -- because this isn't some
make-believe Halloween skeleton, this is the real skeleton inside you.

book_title: Fossils Tell of Long Ago (Let's-Read-and-Find-Out Science 2)
Summary:
A fossil is anything that has been preserved, one way or another, that
tells about life on Earth. But you can make a fossil, too--something
to be discovered a million years from now--and this book will tell you
how.

He describes the funnel cloud and how it forms and [tells] what to do
during a tornado. The book ends on a comfortable note, that the idea
is not to panic but to know what to do to ensure safety.’ —BL. A
Reading Rainbow Selection

We call moving air the wind. In this enlarged edition, find out about
the wind - what causes it, how it can be used to help us, and how it
affects the weather.

Explains how electricity is produced and transmitted, how to create
electricity using an electrical wire and a magnet, how generators
supply electricity for cities, and how electricity works in homes.

book_title: Your Skin and Mine (Let's Read-And-Find-Out Books)
Summary:
Explains the basic properties of skin, how it protects the body, and
how it can vary in color.

Explains what shooting stars are, what they are made of, and what
happens to them when they land on Earth.
Seeds How does a tiny acorn grow into an enormous oak tree?

book_title: What Will the Weather Be? (Let's-Read-and-Find-Out Science 2)
Summary:
Weather Will it be warm or cold? Should we wear shorts or pants? Shoes
or boots? Read and find out why the weather is so difficult to
predict.
Apples/center Have you ever eaten part of a flower?

Wendy Pfeffer describes the amazing metamorphosis from tiny, jellylike
egg, to little fishy tadpole, to great big bullfrog.

Soon, it disappears into a hard shell called a chrysalis. Then the
chrysalis breaks, and a beautiful butterfly flies out of the jar! This
is a perfect beginner's guide to the mystery of metamorphosis.

Discusses the importance of sleep and what happens to our brains and
bodies during slumber. When you feel tired, your body is telling you
that you need rest. Everyone needs sleep. Babies need lots of sleep.
Grown-ups need less sleep.

Have you ever dreamed of being an astronaut? Wondered what it might be
like to see the sun set sixteen times in one day? Open this book and
be transported on an information-packed voyage aboard the space
shuttle.

Describes the parenting habits of the Maiasaura, a dinosaur whose way
of raising children bore similarities to that of birds.
After rain comes down, the sun comes out and dries the puddles.

In this information-packed Let’s-Read-and-Find-Out Science book, Kate
Duke explains what scientists are looking for, how they find it, and
what their finds reveal.

Sounds are all around us. Clap your hands, snap your fingers:
You're making sounds. Read and find out how people and animals use
different kinds of sounds to communicate.

Storms can be scary, but not if you know what causes them. Before the
next thunderstorm, grab this book by veteran science team Franklyn
Branley and True Kelley and learn what causes the flash, crash,
rumble, and roll of thunderstorms!

Sponges come in all shapes, colors, and sizes. Barbara Juster Esbensen
and Holly Keller have paired an engaging text with funny, kid-friendly
illustrations to reveal that a sponge is not just a bath toy.

Frogs Frogs can jump thirty times their own body length, catch insects
on the wing, and breathe underwater or on land. But they must always
keep their skins wet. Read and find out why!

Crawling through the dirt, worms are hard at work, helping plants to
grow. Worms help the fruit and vegetables we eat by loosening the soil
and feeding the plants. Read and find out about these wiggling
wonders!

An emperor penguin lays an egg on the Antarctic ice. In the bitter
cold, miles away from the only source of food, how can the chick
survive?

In this book, featuring remarkably realistic artwork by S.D.
Schindler, you will learn about the silk spiders produce, the webs
they spin, and the prey they capture. You will even learn how to make
a web of your own! Ages 5-9

book_title: Dolphin Talk : Whistles, Clicks, and Clapping Jaws (Let's-Read-and-Find-Out Science 2)
Summary: center Dolphins are smart.

Did Dinosaurs Have Feathers? Birds have feathers, but did you know
some dinosaurs did too? New fossils have shown that as long as 145
million years ago, some dinosaurs had feathers, just as birds do.

Aliki describes and illustrates the techniques and the reasons for the
use of mummification in ancient Egypt.

book_title: The Black Americans : A History in Their Own Words
Summary:
A history of Black people in the United States, as told through
letters, speeches, articles, eyewitness accounts, and other documents.
The long agony of slavery. The jubilation of freedom. The slow,
frustrating road to equality.

book_title: You Read to Me, I'll Read to You
Summary:
‘Thirty-five imaginative and humorous poems for an adult and a child
to read aloud together. . . . The entertaining verses are varied as to
length, rhythm, and subject and are illustrated with harmoniously
amusing drawings.’ —BL.

book_title: The Sky Is Full of Song
Summary:
Poems describe the kinds of things that happen in autumn, winter,
spring, and summer.

book_title: Joyful Noise (rpkg) : Poems for Two Voices
Summary:
Funny, sad, loud, and quiet, each of these poems resounds with a
booming, boisterous, joyful noise. In this remarkable volume of poetry
for two voices, Paul Fleischman verbally re-creates the
"Booming/boisterious/joyful noise" of insects.

book_title: Chemically Active: Experiments You Can Do at Home
Summary:
Gives instructions for performing a variety of experiments, using
easily available materials, that illustrate some basic principles of
chemistry.

book_title: In Your Own Words: A Beginner's Guide to Writing
Summary: A guide to writing prose, both fiction and nonfiction, and poetry.

book_title: Never to Forget: The Jews of the Holocaust
Summary:
One. Two. Three. Often more. Here are the stories of thode people,
recorded in letters and diaries, and in the memories of those who
survived. Seen through their eyes, the horror becomes real.

book_title: Cross Your Fingers, Spit in Your Hat: Superstitions and Other Beliefs
Summary:
Superstitions about such topics as love and marriage, money, ailments,
travel, the weather, and death.

book_title: Indian Captive : The Story of Mary Jemison (Trophy Newbery)
Summary:
Meticulously researched and illustrated with many detailed drawings,
this novel offers an exceptionally vivid and personal portrait of
Native American life and customs.

book_title: Me Me Me Me Me: Not a Novel
Summary:
A children's author recounts her life, including childhood,
schooling, and her early days as a writer.

A snake! Pound for pound, snakes are among the strongest of animals.
Most people fear snakes, but there are only a few that are dangerous
to humans. And if snakes were to disappear, the earth would be overrun
with rats and rodents.

Text and photographs present the physical characteristics, habits, and
natural environment of various species of wolves.

A comprehensive guidebook to all the homes in which Laura Ingalls
Wilder once lived and which have now been preserved as historic
landmarks and museums.

The text of White's tale is accompanied by notes on how the book
was written, White's life and work, and related materials
